greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Matula-numbers computed for rooted trees encoded by A071162/A071163.
comment: Sequence is injective: Any number occurs at most once, as each plane tree encoded by A071162/A071163 is mapped to a unique non-oriented rooted tree. See also A209637, A209638.
Sequence A209638 gives the same terms sorted into ascending order.
link: Indranil Ghosh (terms 0..1000) & Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to Matula-Goebel numbers
program: (Scheme) (define (A209636 n) (let loop ((n (* 2 n)) (m 1)) (cond ((< n 2) m) ((even? n) (loop (/ n 2) (* m 2))) (else (loop (/ (- n 1) 2) (A000040 m))))))
(PARI) A209636(n) = { my(n=2*n, m=1); while(n >= 2, if(!(n%2),m*=2,m = prime(m)); n\=2); m; } \\ _Antti Karttunen_, May 25 2017
print([a(n) for n in range(101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 25 2017, translated from _Antti Karttunen_'s SCHEME code
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 11 2012
